business.headline: Trump doubles metal tariffs to 50% but skips UK. What it means for IndiaUS President Donald Trump plans to double tariffs on imported steel and aluminium, affecting global trade dynamics. The UK's exemption contrasts with challenges for India.

Did Coforge shares drop 80% today? Here's all you need to knowInvestors might have initially mistaken this adjustment for a loss. Despite the apparent drop, the stock actually opened higher at Rs 1,720.05 on Wednesday, with a 0.60% increase. It was up 1.4% on the BSE at 12:18 pm.

Are you eligible for PM-Kisan yojana? Check 20th instalment and requirementsThe upcoming 20th instalment is anticipated to be disbursed in the first or second week of June 2025. Under this scheme, farmers can receive the annual financial aid of Rs 6,000, distributed in three equal instalments of Rs 2,000 every four months.

Stop sudden tax demands: Raghuram Rajan on fixing India's business environmentRaghuram Rajan says India must fix its business environment, starting with killing off surprise tax shocks that are scaring investors and strangling the country's shot at global supply chain glory.

Explained: How India can benefit from striking trade deal with USIndia's challenge goes beyond just sealing a US trade deal, it's about finding the right balance between opening up for growth and safeguarding its own industries.

Scoda Tubes lists flat at issue price amid strong IPO subscriptionScoda Tubes saw good interest during its initial public offering (IPO) phase, which ran from May 28 to May 30, 2025. The IPO was oversubscribed by 57.37 times, highlighting strong market demand.

Trump's student visa curbs opportunity for India, says Raghuram RajanRaghuram Rajan has called the US administration's actions "unfortunate," particularly in how they undermine the long-standing academic and economic ties between the US and countries like India.

India rubbed US the wrong way with arms purchase from Russia: Trump officialSpeaking at an event in Washington, US Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick said that President Donald Trump deeply admires India and the two countries are going to have a great relationship together.

Nvidia overtakes Microsoft to become world's most valuable companyThis is not the first time Nvidia has reached the top. The company had earlier taken the number one spot on 24 January this year but was later overtaken.

India needs 8-9% growth to become Viksit Bharat by 2047: Raghuram RajanIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV's Consulting Editor Rajdeep Sardesai, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan discussed India's economic outlook in uncertain global times. He emphasised the need for 8-9% growth for India to become a developed nation by 2047.
OECD cuts global growth forecast citing trade war risksThe OECD has reduced its global growth forecast to 2.9% for 2025 and 2026, attributing the slowdown to heightened trade tensions.

Credit score made easy: Check it, fix it, boost itYour credit score is mostly shaped by how timely you are with payments, missing even one EMI or credit card due can bring it down.  A score of 750 or above is considered good by most banks and lending companies.

Smallcap stocks are back in action again. Should you ride the wave?Since the market's low in February 2025, the Nifty50 index has risen by 12%. But the real jump has been in the mid and smallcap space. The midcap index has gone up by 20%, and the smallcap index has climbed 22% during the same period.

Sensex tumbles 700 points: What's behind today's stock market decline?The BSE Sensex was trading 740.82 points lower at 80,632.93 at around 1:13 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 187.65 points to 24,528.95. All the other Nifty sectoral indices also fell as volatility rose during the session.

Own property in India? Why you must fix any paperwork issues nowIn fact, for years, the biggest property scam in India has been when someone who isn't the real owner sells a property. The buyer, after paying a huge amount, later finds out they were cheated, and the actual owner was someone else all along.

ITR filing made easy: Here's a simple step-by-step guide to file income tax returnBefore starting your income tax return, ensure you have key documents in hand. These include Form 16 from your employer, Form 26AS, the Annual Information Statement (AIS) and Tax Information Statement (TIS) from the income tax portal, and your bank statements.

India's GDP growth may decline to 6.2% in FY26, says NomuraThe assessment, published in a research note on Monday, comes amid what the brokerage describes as a growing "divergence" between headline indicators like GST collections and other key economic metrics such as automobile sales and bank credit growth.

Prostarm Info Systems shares make strong D-Street debut; list at 19% premiumProstarm Info Systems share price: The stock listed at Rs 125 on the BSE, which was 19.04% higher than its issue price of Rs 105. On the NSE, the stock opened at Rs 120, marking a 14.28% premium over its issue price.
Ola Electric shares tumble over 6% today. Here's whyBy 10:15 am, the stock was trading at Rs 50.52, down 5.9%, after reports of a large equity transaction rattled investors.

Yes Bank shares fall 8% after 3 sessions of gain. Here's whyYes Bank's shares fell 7.95% to touch a low of Rs 21.43. This was a huge change from the recent trend, as the stock had risen 8.4% in the previous session and was gaining for three days in a row.

Trade deal with India in not-too-distant future: US Commerce SecretaryA trade deal between India and the United States could be finalised soon, as negotiations gain momentum following reciprocal tariff tensions, with US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick expressing optimism that both sides have found common ground.

Uber delivery chief steps down after 13 Years; Andrew Macdonald named COOAs senior vice president of Uber's delivery unit, Pierre-Dimitri Gore-Coty oversaw the company's Uber Eats business as well as grocery and other on-demand delivery offerings, and is credited with steering the division through the COVID-19 pandemic.

Adani faces US scrutiny over Iran LPG 'links', denies role, says unaware of probeGautam Adani's firms are under scrutiny from US prosecutors for reportedly importing Iranian LPG into India through Mundra port. A spokesperson denied the company's involvement and said it was not aware of such a probe.

entertainment.headline: Adolescence becomes Netflix's 2nd most-watched English show surpassing Stranger Things 4'Adolescence' has become Netflix's second most-watched English-language series, surpassing 'Stranger Things Season 4' with 141.2 million views in 80 days. Besides, the show 'Wednesday' and non-English hits like 'Squid Game' rank higher in Netflix's all-time viewership.

Janhvi Kapoor's 'champi' session with Khushi was perfect prep before Cannes. WatchBefore actor Janhvi Kapoor's Cannes debut, she enjoyed a relaxing 'champi' from her sister Khushi. Orry posted the video along with other behind-the-scenes glimpses from Cannes.

Thug Life advance booking: Kamal Haasan's film gears up for solid openingEven with all the controversy around the film, 'Thug Life' is generating significant buzz in advance booking. The Kamal Haasan film is looking at collecting a good number on its opening day.

15 years on, Vedam remains Telugu cinema's unmatched masterpieceJune 4 marks 15 years of 'Vedam', a Telugu film that broke conventions with its layered storytelling, symbolic characters, and powerful music. Still fresh and unique, it remains a cinematic milestone that challenges the industry to aspire higher.

Love Island USA Season 7: How to watch, stream schedule, and premiere detailsLove Island USA Season 7 premieres June 3 on Peacock with new twists, ten fresh Islanders in Fiji, and real-time audience interaction through the app. Episodes also air on Bravo and Hulu.

Diddy gave bag of cash to bury hotel assault tape, ex-guard tells courtA former hotel guard testified that Sean Combs paid $100,000 to suppress assault footage. The video, now key evidence in a federal case, supports multiple abuse allegations Combs denies.

general news.headline: We are both Islamic nations: Pak's religion card against India flops in MalaysiaTrying to play the religion card, the Pakistani embassy urged Malaysian government officials to cancel all 10 programmes by the Sanjay Jha-led delegation, saying, 'We are an Islamic country, you are an Islamic country... don't listen to the Indian delegation.'

Chinese scientist, boyfriend arrested for smuggling crop-killing fungus into USTwo Chinese nationals were arrested for smuggling a dangerous crop fungus into the US, posing risks to food security and public health. They face multiple federal charges and possible deportation.

Hindu temple hit by terrorists to be on Bangladesh 20-taka notesThe Muhammad Yunus-led interim government is on a drive to move Bangladesh away from the legacy and memory of Mujibur Rahman, its founding father. The image of a Hindu temple targeted by Islamic terrorists is among those replacing Mujib on the new banknotes. Here's more about the Kantajew temple of Dinajpur on whose premises a mosque was also coming up.

In 2025, after 18 years of heartbreak, Virat Kohli and RCB finally lifted the IPL trophy, changing not just a war-cry, but the emotional script of a generation.

Told Hardik that Pandya household would have 9 trophies: KrunalAfter becoming the first player to win two Player of the Match awards in IPL finals, RCB star Krunal Pandya revealed that he had told his brother Hardik that the Pandya household would boast nine trophies in 11 years.

Virat Kohli deserved IPL trophy more than anyone else: RCB captain Rajat PatidarRajat Patidar said that Virat Kohli deserved to win the IPL trophy as RCB defeated PBKS to end their 18-year wait. Patidar said it was a great opportunity for him to captain Kohli and learn as a captain.

Shreyas Iyer dejected after final heartbreak vs RCB, vows to win IPL next yearPunjab Kings captain Shreyas Iyer was dejected after the narrow final defeat to RCB but said the job was only half done, adding that he and his team would come back stronger in pursuit of the title next year.

IPL 2025: Full list of award winners for the seasonThe IPL 2025 season has come to an end with RCB winning their first title with a final win over PBKS on Tuesday, June 3. Here's a look at all the award winners from the 2025 season.

Anushka Sharma is a Bengaluru girl, RCB winning IPL means so much: Virat KohliIPL 2025 final: Filled with emotions, Virat Kohli thanked wife Anushka Sharma after RCB won their first IPL title in 18 years. Kohli reflected on the unwavering support from Anushka through his highs and lows over the years.

Fireworks in Bengaluru as King Kohli bags IPL: Ee sala cup NamduViral videos showed fireworks lighting up the night skies as Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) fans flooded the streets in celebration after their team finally lifted the IPL 2025 trophy—ending an 18-year wait for their maiden title. RCB clinched a thrilling six-run victory over Punjab Kings in the final at the Narendra Modi Stadium on Tuesday, June 3. Virat Kohli was joined in the celebrations by AB de Villiers and Chris Gayle, as the iconic chant "Ee Sala Cup Namde" was joyfully transformed into "Ee Sala Cup Namdu."

Watch: Virat Kohli hugs Anushka, AB de Villiers after RCB's IPL 2025 triumphAfter 18 years of heartbreaks and near misses, Royal Challengers Bengaluru finally clinched their maiden IPL title, as emotions ran high with Virat Kohli embracing Anushka Sharma and AB de Villiers in unforgettable celebrations.

Ee sala cup namdu: Fans rejoice as Virat Kohli, RCB finally win IPL titleRCB fans and Virat Kohli can finally say 'Ee salad cup namdu' as they won the IPL 2025 title in Ahmedabad on Tuesday, June 3. RCB defeated PBKS by 6 runs at the Narendra Modi stadium on Tuesday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
